item.title: How To Climb Mount Yotei In Ghost Of Yotei (Inheritance Trophy)
item.description:
When it comes to the main story, Ghost of Yotei is rich with things to do. Not to mention, the game also has a lot to do with its side content. In the early stages of the game, Atsu's parents mention that they hid Charms at the peak of Mount Yotei, where she would deserve these Charms if she finishes the climb. This sparks a very interesting side quest where Atsu must reach and climb Mount Yotei to find those Charms. Here's everything you need to know about how to reach and climb Mount Yotei in Ghost of Yotei .

How To Reach Mount Yotei In Ghost Of Yotei

To reach Mount Yotei in Ghost of Yotei , travel west to the Mount Yotei Shrine , located at the western end of the Yotei River. You can find the Shrine between a Dueling Tree and the White Dye House.

Once you reach the Mount Yotei Shrine, there's a clear path of jumping and parkour to reach higher ground.

Reach the top and move forward until you notice a crack in the wall, like a cave entrance. Enter the cave to reach Mount Yotei in Ghost of Yotei . But that's not the end of this journey, as there's still a lot to do to climb Mount Yotei in Ghost of Yotei .

How To Climb Mount Yotei In Ghost Of Yotei

To start the Mount Yotei climb, go to the left side and keep moving until you reach a rocky slide. Slide down and jump, hooking onto the rope at the end.

At some point, Atsu will reach a broken bridge, where there's no way to jump to the other side. However, there are two ropes on her left that she can hook onto. Jump and hook to the first rope using the R2 button, before hooking into the second one. From there, keep moving to the right side, then climb the cliff at the end.

After reaching the small shack, where Atsu wonders if her parents stopped there to rest and enjoy the view, Atsu will reach another area that looks like a dead end. However, if you reach the left side, at the end of this area, you can see a cliff that has a tree in front of it. Jump on them to get one step closer to the peak of Mount Yotei in Ghost of Yotei .

Finally, just a short while before Atsu reaches the top of Mount Yotei, she'll come across a hard rock slide that leads downhill. She needs to slide down and aim to hook onto the rope at the end of that slide to cross that area. After hooking onto the rope, keep going left, climbing the last parts of Mount Yotei, before reaching its peak.

Upon reaching the peak of Mount Yotei, Atsu can immediately spot the Mount Yotei Shrine in the far distance. The path there has a couple of bumpy jumps, but nothing too crazy.

Reach the Mount Yotei Shrine and use the Respect animation to bow and interact with it. Doing that will reward Atsu with the Father's Charm and Mother's Charm .

After getting Atsu's parents' Charms, don't yet interact with the tree trunk next to the Shrine to descend to the Mount Yotei Shrine's entrance, as you can keep scavenging Mount Yotei's peak for more rewards.

If you keep moving on top of the mountain, you'll eventually come across the Pillar of the Fallen, where Atsu will get the Starlight Abyss weapon skin. You can also slide down into Mount Yotei's center to find an Altar of Reflection in the middle. All these rewards make reaching and climbing Mount Yotei a very rewarding experience in Ghost of Yotei .

9.5 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei

item.title: Borderlands 4: Where is Maurice’s Black Market?
item.description:
Maurice's Black Market in Borderlands 4 is an endgame weekly activity that will allow players to purchase some shady goods in exchange for Cash. Maurice's Black Market will remain in one secret location for all players for 7 days before changing spots at random, and we've listed the location where players can find Maurice's Black Market below so you can always see what offerings are on the cards for you this week.

Where is Maurice's Black Market Today in Borderlands 4?

Maurice's Black Market Vending Machine Location

Week 4 has Maurice's Black Market located to the south-west of Fortress Indomita in Idolator's Noose, Fadefields. Players can find the exact location on the map marked above, but for a more detailed idea, players can look here. Players can find the Vending Machine in the west are of Fortress Indomita, where they will find a building on the coast. Inside this building and up the stairs to the top floor is Maurice's Black Market.

When Does Maurice's Black Market Change Locations in Borderlands 4?

Borderlands 4 Weekly Activities Reset Times

Maurice's Black Market will change locations every Thursday at 12 PM ET. (9 AM PT). This is the same reset time for all weekly activities, meaning Moxxi's Big Encore and the Wildcard Mission will also change. Once the reset hits, players will have to refresh their games to find where Maurice's Black Market has decided to venture. This could be anywhere on the entire map, so it's best to complete all Safehouses and all Silos so that you have all the active Fast Travel Stations at the ready to race to the Black Market Vending Machine.

24
8.0 /10
8 /10

item.title: Comparing Ghost of Yotei and Ghost of Tsushima’s Map Sizes
item.description:
Ghost of Yotei is finally here, and some of the biggest questions surrounding the anticipated sequel are how it differs from its predecessor, Ghost of Tsushima . Set 300 years after the events of Ghost of Tsushima , the fresh timeline of Ghost of Yotei opens the door for more advanced weapons and a new story, but one of the most intriguing changes of all is the change in location.

Instead of its predecessor's titular Tsushima Island, Ghost of Yotei is set in Ezo, modern-day Hokkaido. Nestled in the northern regions of Japan, Ezo's landscape differs greatly from Tsushima, but one of the most significant differences of all is how much bigger it is than the island. This paves the way for Ghost of Yotei 's map to be far larger than Ghost of Tsushima 's, but that isn't entirely the case.

Ghost of Yotei's Ezo Avoids Overshadowing Ghost of Tsushima's Map

Ghost of Yotei Features Six Main Regions

  • Tokachi Range
  • Yotei Grasslands
  • Ishikari Plain
  • Oshima Coast
  • Teshio Ridge
  • Nayoro Wilds

Ghost of Tsushima's Map is Split Into Three Regions

  • Izuhara
  • Toyotama
  • Kamiagata

When comparing this to the base version of Ghost of Tsushima , it's clear that Ghost of Yotei 's map has twice as many regions to explore, but developer Sucker Punch has done a good job at making sure the extra areas don't feel overwhelming. While twice as many regions sound larger on paper, Ghost of Yotei uses the jaw-dropping landscape of Ezo to drive home its size difference instead of utilizing actual landmass.

Ghost of Tsushima 's map grows even larger when taking into consideration the Iki Island DLC.

Ghost of Yotei's Map is a Clever Illusion

With smart use of landmarks, landscape features like rivers and grasslands, and seeing the intimidating beauty of Mount Yotei standing in the background, Ghost of Yotei quickly looks like a far more dense world, but it's still relatively close to Ghost of Tsushima 's size.

Developing a version of Ezo that is to-scale would call for a massive map, and because of the nature of Ghost of Yotei 's narrative approach, that simply wouldn't make sense. It would be far too easy to get lost in side quests and exploration, which would ultimately take away from Atsu's revenge-fueled story, so Sucker Punch found a wonderful way to strike a balance that makes players feel as though they're traveling through a much larger map while actually keeping it relatively conservative in size.

In real life, Tsushima Island covers around 269 square miles, while Hokkaido is estimated to be around 32,222 square miles.

Ghost of Yotei's Map Leaves More Room for Surprises

Another way that Ghost of Yotei 's map feels larger actually isn't through its use of landscape, but rather NPCs. Because of Atsu's reputation, Ronin will be on the hunt for her, making every corner of the map a potential route for danger. These Ronin can appear when it's least expected, and while it adds an extra layer of danger, it also makes the world feel larger in a unique way. These Ronin travel in pursuit of Atsu, and once players get a grasp of how much larger the map feels, seeing others making the effort to hunt her down really drives home their dedication, as they've had to face a similar journey across regions.

Ghost of Yotei may not technically be much larger than Ghost of Tsushima , but it definitely feels it, and it does so without going overboard. Sucker Punch has managed to find a way to go bigger and better without being cumbersome, and it's one of the many features that make Ghost of Yotei a worthy sequel.

9.5 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Leaks Mega Feraligatr
item.description:
Two weeks before the launch of Pokémon Legends: Z-A , the Mega Evolution form of Feraligatr has been leaked on social media. In response to the leak, fans stated that the leaked form of Mega Feraligatr in Pokemon Legends: Z-A was consistent with past descriptions that revealed its potential appearance and type.

Known as the Big Jaw Pokemon, Feraligatr first appeared in Pokemon Gold and Silver . As the fully-evolved form of Totodile and Croconaw, Feraligatr is a Water-type Pokemon known for its balanced statistics, with a slight lean toward physical attack and defense. In Pokemon Legends: Z-A , Feraligatr joins Meganium and Emboar as fully-evolved starters players can pick from in their adventures across Lumiose City. Previous Pokemon Legends: Z-A leaks indicated that the upcoming title would have at least 26 new Mega Evolutions in the base game, and Mega Feraligatr was among those mentioned.

Mega Feraligatr Leaked Ahead of Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Launch

With copies of Pokemon Legends: Z-A now out in the wild ahead of its October 16 launch, new information about the game has surfaced on social media. Twitter user Centro posted a picture of Mega Feraligatr as part of the ongoing leaks of information for Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Mega Feraligator's photo was taken from behind, although one clear difference in its appearance is its larger jaw positioned above its head. This red-colored jaw is stated to cover its face like a hood, and pairs with a large lower jaw that covers Feraligatr's neck. Mega Feraligatr is said to be a Water and Dragon dual-type Pokemon, having gained the latter Dragon type once it Mega Evolves. However, Mega Feraligatr's moves and statistics remain unrevealed as of this writing.

In response to Centro's post, Pokemon trainers stated that Mega Feraligatr's appearance is consistent with a previously leaked description of each new Mega Evolution form in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Mega Feraligatr's Water and Dragon dual-typing matches other creatures like Kingdra and Palkia. Although the Dragon-type takes away the Water-type's weakness to Electric attacks, Mega Feraligatr would instead be vulnerable to Fairy and Dragon Pokemon. Given that Fairy-type Pokemon like Florges and Sylveon are prominent in Pokemon Legends: Z-A and the Kalos region overall, Mega Feraligatr could be at a disadvantage in certain situations.

However, Feraligatr is unlikely to be completely defenseless against Fairy-type Pokemon, as it could utilize moves like Metal Claw in previous Pokemon titles to counter them. It remains to be seen how Mega Feraligatr's type and appearance will be considered once Pokemon Legends: Z-A players start forming their battle plans and figuring out what works for them.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Ghost of Yotei Trophy Guide
item.description:
There are 54 Trophies to earn in Ghost of Yotei , and if players want to become the ultimate spirit of vengeance and the protector of Ezo as Atsu, then they are going to want to not only cross off the names of the Yotei Six but also to cross off every Achievement available in Ghost of Yotei . Below, players will find all Trophies in Ghost of Yotei, along with how to get them, so that you can rest assured knowing that this Platinum Trophy is within your grasp. Fear not, as Ghost of Yotei features no missable Trophies . There is also no difficulty-related Trophy in Ghost of Yotei , so feel free to play in the settings for your own comfort, and look below to find which achievements you can begin to hunt for!

Potential spoilers ahead for Ghost of Yotei from the descriptions of the Trophies! We've kept the details light as to not spoil anything big.

Ghost of Yotei Trophy List

How to Unlock All Ghost of Yotei Trophies

Trophy

Description

How to Get

Legendary Onryo

Obtain all trophies.

Acquire all 53 trophies.

The Snake

Cross the first name off your sash.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

The Oni

Extinguish the fire of a cruel warlord.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

The Kitsune

Send Saito’s spymaster back to the shadows.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

The Dragon

Cut down the favored firstborn.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

The Spider

Defeat the son of a tyrant.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

The Onryo Rests

Find a future beyond the hunt.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

The Woman Behind the Mask

Show mercy to the innkeeper’s daughter.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

Twin Wolves

Reunite with a ghost from the past.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

Wrath of the Onryo

Relive the Night of the Burning Tree.

Automatically acquired during the main story.

Way of the Yari

Help Sensei Takahashi defend his dojo.

Complete "The Way of the Yari" trio of Sensei Tales in Ishikari Plain.

Way of the Kusarigama

Help Master Enomoto confront his grandson.

Complete "The Way of the Kusarigama" trio of Sensei Tales in Teshio Ridge.

Way of the Odachi

Help defend Master Yoshida’s dojo in the final battle.

Complete "The Path of the Odachi" (main story) and then "The Odachi's Redemption" at Tokachi Range.

From One Ghost to Another

Acquire the blade of a legendary hero.

Visit the Forgotten Shrine in the south-west region of Oshima Coast to complete this Tale.

Sitturaynu

Share a meal with Huci.

Complete The Heart of the Ainu and The Load We Bear, 2 Side Tales in the Husko Kotan of Nayoro Wilds.

A Moment to Breathe

Get a perfect score in ku-e-shinok.

An archery minigame in the Ainu Hunting Grounds, Yotei Grasslands. Hit all 6 rings without missing a shot.

Unrivaled

Defeat Takezo the Unrivaled on the peak of Mount Yōtei.

Complete "Takezo the Unrivalled" started by completing a Dueling Tree (first found south of Shikotsu River in Yotei Grasslands), followed by "The Five Teachings".

Kunai Defender

Help Hana protect her farms.

Complete "The Winter Farms" Tale in Teshio Ridge.

Gift for Destruction

Help Ina fend off the Oni Raiders.

Complete "The Bomb Maker" and "Fight Fire With Fire" Tales in Ishikari Plain.

Naming a Friend

Pick a name for your horse.

Complete the "Old Trails" Tale in the Yotei Grasslands.

From the Hip

Perform a Pistol Parry during a Standoff.

Unlock the Tanzutsu from Guns and Consequences in Oshima Coast and purchase the skills: Standoff Streak and Standoff Unlock: Pistol. Enter a Standoff and beat the first enemy with Triangle, then the second enemy with Triangle, then the third with R1.

The Owl's Talon

Use a Kusarigama Assassination to kill an enemy from a distance.

Unlock the Kusarigama from The Way of the Kusarigama in Teshio Ridge and purchase the skills: Ferocious Whirlwind and Lethal Talons. In stealth, get behind an enemy and press Triangle + Circle.

Sayonara

Shoulder Charge or Typhoon Kick an enemy off a cliff to their death.

The Shoulder Charge skill allows you to press Circle while sprinting, and you can use that to knock an enemy off a cliff, easily achieved by luring them to ledges.

You Dropped This

Disarm and kill an enemy with their own weapon.

Purchase the Disarm Counter skill or the Onryo Strike skill to use abilities and Spirit that allows you to disarm enemies. Pick up their weapon up and throw it at them.

The Horror

Make 20 enemies collapse in fear using Onryō’s Howl.

Use the Onryo's Howl ability 20 times.

Wolf Bait

Use an empty Sake jar to trigger a Wolf kill.

Purchase the Wolf Skills: Wolf Howl and Wolf Strike Summon, then throw an empty Sake jar to try and spawn the Wolf to kill an enemy.

Two as One

Complete a successful Standoff or Assassination with a companion.

During a Standoff, you can be joined by the Wolf, or a Companion through the story. Successfully beat the Standoff to get the trophy.

Brush Fire

Kill an enemy by catching grass on fire.

Use Fire Arrows with the Hankyu Bow and set fire to the grass to burn an enemy alive.

Sake Flight

Collect 10 full jars of Sake.

Drink Sake by holding Down on the D-Pad, then pick up more from camps or by purchasing them from merchants.

Very Persuasive

Interrogate 10 enemies.

Enemies will automatically be interrogated during the story.

Charming

Upgrade 10 charms at least once.

Each Charm you collect has its own upgrade requirement that you can view in the Charms section of Gear in the Menu.

Like Father, Like Daughter

Fully upgrade the Wolf Blade.

There are 4 upgrades to the Wolf Blade, each requiring their own materials, and they can be upgraded at Father's Forge at Home.

Purely Decorative

Acquire 30 pieces of Vanity Gear.

Vanity Gear means Armor Dyes and Weapon Kits, so simply purchase them from merchants at Inns and Villages.

For All Occasions

Acquire all Armor.

There are 9 Armor Sets to obtain outside of the ones automatically acquired in the main story:

Taro's Armor - purchased from Taro

Armor of the Undying - The Undying Samurai Tale in Shikari Plain

Crimson Kimono - The Crimson Kimono Tale in Teshio Ridge

Dragonfly Armor - The Dragonfly Armor Tale in Tokachi Range

Spider Lily Armor - The Spider Lily General Tale in Tokachi Range

Robes for Sitturaynu - The Heart of an Ainu Tale in Nayoro Wilds

Ginji's Guard Armor - Pride Before Tea Tale in Oshima Coast

Fundoshi - Complete all Hot Springs

Bounty Master Armor - Soma the Condemned Bounty in Oshima Coast

Tools of a Warrior

Acquire all Melee weapons.

There are 4 Melee Weapons:

Wolf Blade (default weapon)

Dual Katana - Acquired during the main story

Odachi - Acquired during the main story (The Saito Brothers)

Kusarigama - Complete The Way of the Kusarigama Sensei Tale in Teshio Ridge

Take Aim

Acquire all Ranged weapons.

There are 4 Ranged Weapons:

Hankyu - Purchased from Ran the Bowyer at villages and inns

Yumi - Purchased from Ran the Bowyer at villages and inns

Bombs - Complete The Bomb Maker Sensei Tale in Ishikari Plain

Tanegashima - Acquired during the main story (The Saito Brothers)

Quick Draw

Acquire all Quickfire weapons.

There are 5 Quickfire weapons. 2 are acquired through the main story. Here are the optional 3:

Metsubushi - Crow Genzo Bounty, in Yotei Grasslands

Kunai - The Winter Farms Sensei Tale in Teshio Ridge

Tanzutsu - Guns and Consequences Sensei Tale in Oshima Coast

Inheritance

Acquire your parents’ charms from the peak of Mount Yōtei.

Climb Mount Yotei and pray at the shrine found at the top.

Gifts for a Ghost

Collect 8 offerings left for the onryō.

These can be acquired at each Inn after each chapter of the main story has been completed.

Trickster Fox

Solve all the Nine Tails’ puzzle boxes.

There are a total of 12 Nine Tails Puzzle Boxes to collect in specific locations, each with their own solution.

An Artist's Eye

Complete all sumi-e paintings.

There are 15 sum-e paintings:

4 in Yotei Grasslands

3 in Ishikari Plain

2 in Tokachi Range

2 in Nayoro Wilds

2 in Teshio Ridge

2 in Oshima Coast

Memento

Personalize a scene in Photo Mode.

Enter Photo Mode with Right on the D-Pad and press any option, whether that's rolling the camera or changing the weather.

Guardian of Inari

Receive the Fox Mask after completing all Fox Dens.

After finding all 11 Fox Dens, head to Sarufutsu Lighthouse in Teshio Ridge and access the Hunting Camp Hideout. Solve the fox statue puzzle and continue through to find a woman who gives you the Fox Mask.

Like Mother, Like Daughter

Learn all shamisen songs.

There are 8 songs in total, but you already start with 1, so there are 7 to go:

Song of Shrines - acquired from an NPC who camps with you at random

Song of the Wolf - complete 4 Wolf Dens

Song of the Spirit - Complete Master of the Shamisen in Yotei Grasslands

Song of Well-Being - Found on the west coast of Ishikari Plain

Song of the Ainu - Complete The Soul of an Instrument in Tokachi Range

Song of Revenge - Donate to the ronin in Shizunai Woods

Song of Vanity - Found north of Crimson Forest in Teshio Ridge

Wolves of Ezo

Complete all the Wolf Dens.

There are 10 Wolf Dens across Ezo, and each requires you to hunt raiders with the Wolf.

2 in Yotei Grasslands

2 in Ishikari Plain

2 in Tokachi Range

1 in Nayoro Wilds

2 in Teshio Ridge

1 in Oshima Coast

Body, Mind, and Spirit

Complete all Bamboo Strikes, Shrine Climbs, and Hot Springs.

There are 15 Bamboo Strikes, 13 Shrine Climbs, and 16 Hot Springs around Ezo. Speak with NPCs and purchase maps from Cartographers in villagers to find them, or follow the golden bird to locate them.

Spear Fishing

Spear 5 fish with the yari.

Acquire the Yari melee weapon from Sensei Takahashi's "The Way of the Yari" side mission in the Ishikari Plain and use it in the water.

Master Bounty Hunter

Complete all Bounties.

There are 31 bounties, so venture to villages in each region and visit the bounty boards, and speak with Kojiro after every bounty until there are none left.

Moments of Reflection

Find 30 Altars of Reflection.

There are over 60 Altars of Reflection to find, but for this trophy, you just need 30. You can find them scattered around each region, but you can get 22 from the Yotei Six Camps.

Child of the Mountain

Solve all Mountain Reliquary puzzles.

There are 5 Mountain Reliquary Puzzles:

1 in Yotei Grasslands

1 in Ishikari Plain

1 in Tokachi Range

1 in Teshio Ridge

1 Oshima Coast

Good with Coins

Win a charm from playing zeni hajiki.

Zeni hajiki is a gambling minigame you can find at any Inn, and simply by winning, you get a charm.

Fireside Performance

Play a shamisen song while camping.

Access your camp by selecting Left on the D-Pad when with your horse, and select your shamisen to play a song.

Speaking with the Land

Bow or play your shamisen at 10 special places throughout Ezo.

Special Places are marked as a wooden sign with a symbol of a samurai bowing. These are scattered all over Ezo. To confirm you've bowed correctly, the environment will change around you with a blow of leaves.

For the Living

Rid Ezo of all Yōtei Six Camps.

There are 22 Yotei Six Camps, and all enemies must be killed to takeover the camp.

3 in Yotei Grasslands

5 in Ishikari Plain

2 in Tokachi Range

7 in Teshio Ridge

5 in Oshima Coast

9.5 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei
